OP

The Pelt

Jan 1, 2023

They wear with dignity their in-
dignity; are, have been, our rumour.
Disproportion, between error
after error, fine measure of such

things as resist it, bears us little
resemblance. The alabaster sun
models the skin which is not,
the viscera, the teeth, the marrow,

our own, on to the bone which is
in marble, metal: sculpture, the
life outside inside us, unearthed
at Melos, domesticate the rot.
